title: Rebrand to Bey Hub X with theme system and new logo

requirements.summary: Update all frontend references from 'The X' to 'Bey Hub X'
acceptanceCriteria: The browser tab title displays 'Bey Hub X'
The header navigation shows 'Bey Hub X' as the site name
The homepage hero section references 'Bey Hub X'
All meta tags and SEO references use 'Bey Hub X'

file_operations.description: Update the <title> tag to 'Bey Hub X' and update all meta tags (og:title, og:site_name, twitter:title, description) to reference 'Bey Hub X' instead of 'The X'. Update the meta description to describe the Bey Hub X platform.
Replace the site name text 'The X' with 'Bey Hub X' in the header navigation. Update both the desktop and mobile menu site name displays to show 'Bey Hub X'.
Update the hero section heading and all text references from 'The X' to 'Bey Hub X'. Update the welcome message and feature descriptions to reference 'Bey Hub X' as the platform name.

requirements.summary: Implement theme system with dark/light mode toggle and persistence
acceptanceCriteria: A theme switcher component is accessible in the UI (e.g., in the header or settings)
Users can select between at least dark mode and light mode
The selected theme persists across browser sessions using localStorage
All existing UI components (buttons, cards, inputs, etc.) respond correctly to theme changes
The theme applies immediately without requiring a page reload

file_operations.description: Create a custom React hook that manages theme state (dark/light), reads from and writes to localStorage for persistence, and applies theme changes by toggling the 'dark' class on the document root element. Export useTheme hook with theme state and toggle function.

Create a theme toggle component that uses the useTheme hook to display the current theme and toggle between dark and light modes. Use shadcn/ui Button component with appropriate icons (sun/moon) to indicate the current theme. The component should be compact enough to fit in the header.
Import and integrate the ThemeToggle component into the AppHeader. Place it in the navigation area alongside the login button and inbox icon, ensuring it works in both desktop and mobile layouts.

Verify and enhance the existing OKLCH-based color system to ensure all color variables work correctly in both light and dark modes. Ensure the .dark class properly overrides all necessary CSS variables for a complete dark theme. No new color system needed; use existing variables.

requirements.summary: Replace site logo with new Beyblade X image
acceptanceCriteria: The new logo appears in the application header
The logo is responsive and scales appropriately on mobile devices
The logo maintains its aspect ratio and visual quality
The logo file is stored as a static asset in frontend/public/assets/generated/

file_operations.description: Add an element for the new logo using the workspace file path frontend/public/assets/generated/bey-hub-x-logo.dim_200x200.png. Position the logo next to or in place of the site name text 'Bey Hub X'. Ensure the logo is responsive with appropriate sizing (e.g., h-8 or h-10) and maintains aspect ratio. Include alt text 'Bey Hub X logo'.
